185958589.review:
Warhammer 40.000: Space Marine, ursprünglich 2011 veröffentlicht, kehrt in der Anniversary Edition zurück und bietet erneut actiongeladene Third-Person-Shooter-Kost im düsteren Warhammer 40.000 Universum. Spieler schlüpfen in die Rolle eines Space Marines des Ordens der Ultramarines und kämpfen gegen Horden von Orks und Chaos-Kräften.

Was gut ist:

Brutale Action: Space Marine konzentriert sich auf intensive Nahkämpfe und brachiale Schusswechsel. Das Spielgefühl ist wuchtig und befriedigend, besonders im Nahkampf mit Kettenschwert und Energiehammer. Viel Blut und Gore sorgen für die passende Atmosphäre im 40k-Universum.
Gute deutsche Sprachausgabe: Die deutsche Synchronisation ist gelungen und trägt zur Immersion bei.
Hohe FPS auf moderner Hardware: Dank der älteren Engine läuft das Spiel auf aktueller Hardware in der Regel mit sehr hohen Bildraten, was für ein flüssiges Spielerlebnis sorgt.
Authentisches Warhammer 40.000 Setting: Das Spiel fängt die Atmosphäre des Warhammer 40.000 Universums gut ein, mit detaillierten Charaktermodellen und Umgebungen. 
Anniversary Edition Inhalte: Die Anniversary Edition enthält alle DLCs und bietet somit den kompletten Inhalt des Spiels.
Was weniger gut ist:

Veraltete Steuerung: Die Steuerung kann sich heute etwas hakelig und unpräzise anfühlen, besonders im Vergleich zu modernen Shootern. 

Grafik mit Schwächen: Obwohl die Grafik für ihr Alter noch passabel ist, fallen die teils matschigen Texturen und die vielen Brauntöne auf. Hier merkt man dem Spiel sein Alter deutlich an.
Wiederholungen: Einige Missionen können sich wiederholen und eintönig anfühlen, da der Fokus stark auf dem Kämpfen liegt. 

Fazit:

Warhammer 40.000: Space Marine Anniversary Edition ist ein spaßiger und actionreicher Third-Person-Shooter für Fans des Warhammer 40.000 Universums. Wer über die veraltete Steuerung und die grafischen Schwächen hinwegsehen kann, bekommt ein brutales und unterhaltsames Spielerlebnis mit guter deutscher Sprachausgabe und hoher Performance auf moderner Hardware. Für Nostalgiker und 40k-Enthusiasten ist es definitiv einen Blick wert, besonders wenn man die Anniversary Edition im Angebot findet.

185893774.review:
GÜNCELLEME: Oyunu "how long to beat" istatistiklerine uygun olarak bitirdim. Youtube'dan diğer oyuncuların videolarını da seyrettim. "Sorun bende mi acaba?" diye şüpheleniyordum ama artık rahatlıkla söyleyebilirim ki görüşlerimde bir sakatlık yok. Bir süre uzak durup multiplayer kısmına bakarım ama o neydi gız?

----Tek kişilik hikaye modu incelemesi----

Evet karanlık gelecekte sadece savaş var. İnsanlığın galaktik imparatorluğunu ayakta tutabilmek için insanlar baskıcı dindar bir rejimin altında eziliyor. 

Ben de oyunun tasarımı altında eziliyorum.  14 yaşında bir oyunu günümüz standartlarına göre sert eleştirmek çok doğru değil diye düşünebilirsiniz ama ne yazık ki iyi yaşlanmamış. 

Aynı anda -bakın aynı anda diyorum- hem siper savaşı hem melee kombat yapmanız isteniyor. Şaka yapmıyorum, cidden böyle. Bunu iyiye yoracaklar olabilir. Bu sefer de düşmanlar da hem melee geliyor hem de uzak mesafeden sıkıyor. Sizi siperden çıkarmak için el bombası gibi aşırtılarak atılan saldırılara bolca başvuruyorlar. Sizin pozisyonunuzu inanılmaz iyi tutturuyorlar. Siper ardında saklanmanızın bir anlamı yok. Siperden azıcık çıktınız mı? Ninja ya da Shroud'u geçen bir aim ile de sürekli ateş ediyorlar ama sürekli böyle hiç durmuyorlar. Berserker gibi dalmanız da direkt ölümünüz demek. 

Eşlikçileriniz var ama saldırıları tanklamakta başarısızlar. Kasıtlı olarak hem düşük hasar vuruyorlar hem de isabet yüzdeleri inanılmaz kötü. Savaşın keşmekeşi içinde canınızın eridiğini fark edemiyorsunuz bile. Canınızı yenilemek için ya ulti açacaksınız ya da sersemleyen düşmanı infaz edeceksiniz. Can yenileme ve infaz esnasında hasar almaya da devam ettiğinizi belirteyim. Yenilenen zırhınız da var ama oyun sizi siperde görmek istemediğinden yenilenme fırsatını çok zor buluyorsunuz hatta bulamıyorsunuz. Pek çok haritada ölüp ölüp en iyi taktiği tahmin etmeniz lazım ama buna çok da güvenmeyin. Oyunda bazen glitch dediğimiz tuhaflıklar oluşuyor. Oyunu bozan bir hata ile karşılaşmadım ama bazen ben bazense düşman bir yerlere takılıp durdu veya kayboldu. Kafasına 8 kez sıkıp indirdiğim iblise ikinci turda bir şarjör boşalttım ölmedi. Kendinizi "Noluyo ya?" derken bulacaksınız. Glitch olmasa da savaş mekaniklerinin hengamesi dengenizi yeterince bozacak. 

Peki buna rağmen her savaştan sonra başarı hissi alacak mısınız? Hayır. Yapay yollarla zorlaştırılmış bu oyunla travma sonrası stres sendromuna yakalanacaksınız. Pentagram'ın Sonsuz şarkısında "Zor günlerin ardında huzur olmaz." diye bir kısım var. Bu oyunu oynayınca anladım ne demek istediğini. Bütün bunlar Warhammer 40K evreninin sertliği içinse yapımcılara kötü bir haberim var. Olmamış. Ayarını kaçırmışsınız diyeceğim ama hafif kalır. Elinizin ayarını s*****m denir böyle bir durumda. Yanınıza geldiğinde patlayan intihar bombacısı ork köpekleri ile yeşil lazer sıkan kaosun insan askerlerini de kim tasarladıysa ona daha sert laflar hazırladım. 

Oyunun ortasındayım. Şu ana kadar adam gibi bir tane bölüm sonu canavarına denk geldim. Gimmickli bir boss ve nasıl geçtiğimi de halen anlayabilmiş değilim. Oyunu bitirince rehberlere ve diğer oyuncuların videolarına bakacağım. Dost Kayaoğlu'nun serisine gelecekte girer mi bilmiyorum ama benim  "Yapacağınız Oyuna Sokayım" listemin ilk beşinde yer buldu. 

İnceleme yazısını yazmak için oyunun bitişini bekleyemedim anlayacağınız. Zaten, görüşlerimin bu saatten sonra çok değişeceğini düşünmüyorum. "Sahte imparatora ölüm!" diyen yolunu kaybetmiş arkadaşlara inat, insanlığın imparatorunun anadolu çocuğu olması nedeniyle, bu toprağın insanı olması nedeniyle oyunu bitireceğim. Zordan kaçmayız ama yazık etmişsiniz be kardeşim. 

Bu arada, oyunu fare ve klavye ile oynayacaksanız kontrolleri kendinize göre değiştirin. Kesin yapın bunu ya da insanlığın imparatoru için ruhunuzu feda etmeye hazır olun.

185786185.review:
*Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine*
----------------------------------------------------
Desparado, um dos melhores jogos que zerei em 2024. Com o lançamento de Space Marine 2, resolvi jogar o primeiro (já que o 2 custa um rim para comprar e outro rim para rodar)... E PUT* QUE O PARIU, QUE JOGO BOM DO CRALH!
Fazia tempo que eu não conseguia parar de jogar alguma coisa. Geralmente, jogo 1 ou 2 horas por dia de cada jogo que tenho instalado, mas Space Marine me viciou o suficiente para ficar horas brincando no online (que, surpreendentemente, ainda é bem ativo).

Controlamos um brutamontes chamado Capitão Titus, veterano dos Ultramarines, uma das legiões de elite dos Space Marines, em uma missão para proteger o Império da Humanidade contra ameaças devastadoras. O jogo se passa em Graia, um planeta que está sob ataque de uma gigantesca horda de Orks. Com a Guarda Imperial incapaz de conter a invasão, os Space Marines são enviados para restaurar a ordem e salvar o planeta. Acompanhado pelo Sargento Sidonus e o jovem Marine Leandros, Titus lidera a missão para eliminar os Orks e proteger os recursos de Graia.

Oferecendo uma jogabilidade focada em combate visceral, misturando combate corpo a corpo e tiroteios, o jogo captura a brutalidade e o poder dos Space Marines. Ele traz armas icônicas como o Chainsword, Thunder Hammer e Power Axe para esmagar hordas e mais hordas de inimigos. O arsenal de armas à distância é diversificado e inclui rifles bólter, plasma guns, metralhadoras pesadas e lançadores de granadas, cada um com características únicas.
Não há regeneração automática de saúde. Para recuperar HP, o jogador precisa realizar execuções em inimigos atordoados.

A simplicidade das mecânicas do jogo o torna tão gratificante, já que basicamente temos que andar para frente e dilacerar as mais diversas hordas de inimigos... porém, tal fator é feito com tanta "maestria" que me trouxe uma experiência incrivelmente divertida e marcante (além de me deixar muito ansioso para jogar sua nova sequência). Uma das poucas ocasiões em que joguei o online por gostar e não apenas para caçar conquistas.

O que mais eu poderia querer? Trilha sonora boa, história bem escrita, protagonista fod*, gameplay insana que mistura TPS com elementos hack and slash, ambientação bem feita e online divertido = Jogaço da porr*.
Sim, também fiquei com o pé atrás de pagar os 36 e pouco na promoção, com aquele medo de ser um jogo meia boca... mas digo que valeu cada centavo e até valia mais! Pode comprar que é sucesso. (Não vale R$ 104,00)
----------------------------------------------------
10

185764960.review:
8/10

I played this because my friend wanted me to play Space Marine 2 with him and I already had this game somehow, so I was like alright, I'll give this a try. I've have very little knowledge of the Warhammer universe, and this was my first Warhammer game I've played. While I'm not a full on converted fan at this point, I am intrigued and am looking into the actual wargame itself now.

At one point while I was about halfway through the game, my wife walked in the room and said, "this game looks like its just killing orks over and over again." She's not wrong. The game could be viewed as repetitive, and it would be a fair criticism. New weapons are given far too early and new enemies don't show up until way later in the game. Fortunately, the game doesn't overstay its welcome by only being about a 9 hour game. The best I can compare this to was my experience playing 2016 Doom. Fun gameplay, but repetitive, and when I was done I was done.

That being said, what seemed at first as a stoic, stale bunch of marines ended up coming together nicely with their slightly differing personalities, and I was surprised by the ending. It does have me excited for the next one.

If you're interested in Space Marine 2, this one does seem to be pretty good to play first, a good amount does happen in the story. It also runs fantastic on the Steam Deck.

185619982.review:
Погружение в мир космических десантников — это всегда впечатляющее и эпичное приключение, особенно когда на кону стоят такие сражения, как в этом проекте. Вы становитесь Сержантом Титусом, элитным бойцом Империума, которому предстоит отбить орков и силы Хаоса от судьбоносных объектов.

Графика, хоть и устаревшая, создаёт необходимую атмосферу, передавая величие и мрак вселенной Warhammer 40K. Каждое оружие и каждый шаг в броне космодесантника ощущаются с мощью, как и положено настоящим героям, которым предстоит сражаться до последней капли крови. Враги — орки, хаоситы — не простые пушечные мясо, они настоящие испытания, готовые затопить вас в море боли и разрушений.

Игра предлагает массу удовольствия через:

Мощные сражения, где каждый бой не просто экшен, а настоящее испытание для игрока.

Развитие персонажа: улучшение оружия и брони, новые способности и тактические возможности.

Погружение в мир Warhammer: каждый элемент, от декораций до диалогов, ощущается как часть огромного вселенной.


Сюжет затягивает, история о Титусе и его братьях по оружию не даёт заскучать. Погружение в каждое сражение и ощущение всей мощи Империума — это то, что делает игру такой запоминающейся.

8.5/10 — за эпичность, чувство мощи и атмосферу Warhammer 40K. Это настоящая находка для всех поклонников франшизы и любителей высококачественного экшн-геймплея!

185414948.review: 單純暴力的戰鎚40K動作遊戲。之前都是用指揮官視點體驗世界觀，這款直接身處戰場挺有新鮮感的。當年中文代理名叫「戰鎚：殺無雙」，實際玩過以後就知道為什麼二代直接改回原名星際戰士，因為真的...不怎麼無雙。遊戲內回血只能靠打暈敵人後處決，或是怒氣值滿以後開能力，兩者都沒有無敵時間，特別是處決動畫還很長，過程中被打會一直扣血，導致回的速度還比不上扣的速度。前期碰到四五個拿槍的歐克圍射，死，碰到拿雙刀狂暴的被砍到兩三刀，死，連續碰到自爆兵，死，被手榴彈炸到，死，搞得星際戰士好像紙裝甲一樣，建議想無腦無雙的話開簡單難度玩就好。多人戰役可以自訂外型什麼的但很多東西都要農，現在也沒什麼人在玩一代多人了，主玩多人連線的話直接去玩二代會比較好。單人戰役普通難度一般人大概平均7小時左右可過關，不擅長動作遊戲的話可以玩到10+個小時，由於過檢查點以後掛掉重來HP會補滿，子彈也還算給得充裕，真的打不贏可以反覆重試堆屍過。劇情算不過不失吧，玩完有一種看完一部動作電影的感覺，不少地方讓人有既視感，除了打最終boss有些反高潮以外整體來說還算是個不錯的體驗。

After completing Space Marine 2, I decided to go back and play the original. And you know what? I really enjoyed it! The campaign is solid, and I found the Ork Warboss and Chaos Lord much more interesting and memorable as characters compared to the bosses in SM2.

I wanted to try out the multiplayer, but sadly there's barely anyone playing these days. But what really blew me away was seeing just how much SM2's developers took the core mechanics, features, and groundwork from the original game and carried them over into the sequel. And they didn't just copy-paste - they managed to evolve every single element in such an impressive way.

So massive props to the SM1 devs for creating this awesome game with such a memorable main character and nailing down those core mechanics. And equal props to the SM2 team for taking the series to the next level.

Recommended! 👍

This is my second copy of this game. I played on Xbox 360 when it originally released. This game is what got me into Warhammer 40k. Where do I even start... reviewing this game in 2025 is wild... but here goes:

In 2025 I still think this game is a must play. Not for the gameplay necessarily. Definitely not for the graphics lol then what for? It is history. It is gaming history. It is Xbox history. It is Warhammer history. Not to mention a treasure trove of lore and fan service. The Anniversary edition adds some cool armor and really smoothes everything out. The campaign, I still maintain is one of my favorites in any action game. The story is just awesome. One of those games that has you pausing to look up lore the whole time. Those are my favorite kind. PVP and PVE is also a blast! Customization is just as detailed as I remember. Although the graphics kind of ruin it seeing the Corvus helm and all of the other old armour patterns is so sick (AND NEEDS ADDED TO SM2 lol)

TLDR: I love this game. Whether you like Warhammer or not you probably will to. Especially if you had fun with gears of war back in the day. That is all. Until next time!

The Emperor Protects!

184847676.review:
Unremarkable but competent action game set in the WH40k setting. Played this to eventually get to the sequel.

Entertaining couple hours for the single-player campaign with basic ranged & melee combat. A lot of it felt like a corridor shooter combined with (somewhat stiff) hack & slash that's very much of that generation of gaming. Some sections are just empty hallways with vacant rooms to get you from A to B.

Story wasn't very compelling, but the characters were done well enough. Optional pick-ups have more lore.
There's a good sense of grimdark going on, but remains pretty bland throughout even with its set pieces.

You don't play this for deeply complex gameplay, you play this to smash and blast through orks.
At the time this was your best option to do so, and it's still a fun time.

184689227.review:
I would recommend this game based on the information that follows:
1. This is a Run 'n Gun/ Hack 'n Slash game from 2011. It follows the Gear of War style of gameplay and has all the limitations of that style of game. That said, even in 2025, I found the game entertaining. The graphics and sounds were dated but not distractingly so. With numerous auto-save points the game wasn't overly punishing on the normal skill level for an average player. If this is your style, or you want to try out this style of game, I feel that it's a solid choice.
2. As a fan of Warhammer 40K, this game gets almost all of the beats right. For the most part, it FEELS like a WH40K game should. There are some very minor lore issues/design choices that may slightly annoy the most die-hard fans of the property, but for 99% of people, this will be a really cool experience within the grimdark setting of this universe. For people just discovering this franchise, expect to get a taste/feel for this world but bear in mind that you will likely want to look to Youtube, books and/or other games to truly understand what is happening in this game from a lore perspective.

184611944.review:
Stars: 4/5

For my entry into the Warhammer universe, Space Marine is an interesting experience.

Graphics: For an older title, they visuals have aged well. The grimdark aesthetic of the Warhammer 40K universe is beautifully realised, capturing its industrial and brutal tone.

Gameplay: The mechanics are straightforward, though the attack buttons can be confusing to first-time players migrating from other fps titles. However, as you progress, fights demand more strategy and awareness, with punishing consequences for bullheadedness. 

Enemies: The variety and design of enemies makes encounters feel fresh, with each enemy type posing unique challenges. BTW, Chaos Psykers can eat ****.

Story: The narrative is outstanding. It pulls you into the Warhammer 40K universe with an epic and immersive tale, carefully and cleverly explaining the lore and workings without overwhelming the player with information.

Conclusion
If you're a fan of Warhammer 40K or just looking for a solid action game with weighty combat and an engaging story, Space Marine is well worth your time.

184577151.review:
Pretty standard length singleplayer shooter campaign. Took about 9 hours on hard for me, but I don't play a whole lot of shooters so more experienced players could probably complete it faster. Fun through to the end. Enemy variety is there but there were clearly some interesting choices made in terms of difficulty, especially in the last couple of missions. 

When it comes to action games I'm more of a melee enjoyer than a ranged player and somehow I didn't know that this game had such a significant hack-and-slash component. The core gameplay loop essentially boils down to:

[olist]
[*] enter battle arena
[*] use ranged weaponry to eliminate gun-wielding enemies before the melee enemy types can approach you
[*] use sword/axe/hammer to eliminate melee enemy types
[*] loot combat arena and leave
[/olist]

It may be because I was playing on hard but there were many times where it felt like deviating from this formula guaranteed death. If the close-ranged enemies reached me before I could eliminate the long-ranged enemies, I would die. If I tried to eliminate the gun-wielding enemies with my melee weapon, I would die. If I tried to shoot the melee enemies, they would tank my hits, get close (with my limited movement speed from shooting) and I would die. Obviously different enemies should have strengths and weaknesses but I did find myself wishing for more ways to approach combat. I think having a few additional movement options (even with the dodge roll) would have gone a long way. [spoiler]There are a couple of sections where you're given a jump pack which dramatically changes the gameplay for a short while, but I felt like the only real way to get through these sections was to launch into the air and ground pound into the nearest group of enemies with the thunder hammer over and over. The thunder hammer is a lot of fun though. I play greatsword builds in games whenever I can and this scratched that itch pretty well.[/spoiler]

The controls feel pretty old. I played through on a controller and it felt more like I was playing Dead Space than Fortnite but I think it's just a PS3 era thing since I also had this compaint about Mass Effect and some of the other shooters of that generation, and when I tried it with mouse and keyboard it felt pretty good (despite the keyboard bindings being... unique).

The writing certainly exceeded my expectations. This is the first Warhammer-related video game that I've played in any significant capacity and I understand that Relic had a fully developed IP to work with but I was still pleasantly surprised by the dialogue, although I will say that the greater story could have been developed further. [spoiler]It seemed like they may have been setting it up for a sequel but with Space Marine 2 only coming out this year it feels like a rather lacklustre way to end the game. I'd be remiss not to also mention the final boss fight, which was quite underwhelming to me. To quote many people on the internet, it is more of a quick time event than a proper boss fight. Since I struggled for a bit with the handful of waves that had to be dealt with before the encounter with Nemeroth I felt accomplished enough to not care that much about what came after so this wasn't a huge deal for me, but I imagine it would be for some people.[/spoiler]

I didn't touch the multiplayer.

Also, [b]if you're having trouble getting the game to launch on PC (updating executable)[/b]: what worked for me was downloading DirectX version 9.x from the Microsoft website.

Anyways, none of the things I mentioned in this review really lessened my enjoyment of the game so I'd still recommend it to anyone who enjoys Warhammer or third person shooters. Definitely get it on sale though. 

I mainly played this with a current-gen Xbox controller on a docked Steam Deck (non-OLED) at 1440p with some brief stints with KB&M on an OptiPlex 790.

184273303.review:
[h1][b] TLDR: A good game showcasing the power of the ultramarines. Due to the game not aging well, mechanic issues, and a publisher increasing the prices of this game for the sequel, I cannot recommend. [/b] [/h1]

[h1]PROS: [/h1]
✅Fun ork-slaughtering mayhem
✅Some epic larger-scale battles 

[h1]CONS: [/h1]
➖Technical issues
➖Levels can be a bit bland and on-rails
➖Graphics did not age well
➖Melee can be hard to aim
➖No option to skip cutscenes after dying and restarting
➖Price bump cause of SM2 release??

[h1] [b] Content (Game world/Narrative/Length) – [5/10] [/b] [/h1]
Game World: In Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine (W40k SM) you primarily explore a single world that is under attack by “Orks” (not to be confused with orcs). This planet has been thoroughly ravaged by orks and much of the locations you explore are war-torn and destroyed. This does not leave much variation in the levels, as between the sundered city environments, you have the Warhammer 40k universe which is generally grim by itself. Even perhaps worse, is the levels are so incredibly linear that what little side paths there are will either contain ammo/grenades, or the games single collectable item - audio logs. 
Overall, while I love the W40k universe, it's a tough sell to consider the game world a place worth visiting more than once (unless you’re like me and quit midway through and decide to revisit it 10 years later before you play the sequel….). The world just doesn’t feel welcoming and barely consists of what I would consider a world dripping with W40k influence, see W40k Darktide for a beautiful 40k world. 

Narrative: You play as the venerable and simply badass Captain Titus as you purge orks from the planet in the name of the emperor. While you don’t have much background for Titus or what got him to his position of captain in the ultramarines, he’s great at what he does - stomping ork face. You lead him and 2 other marines through the ravaged planet to find the power source capable of destroying the planet if it falls into enemy hands. Spoilers: 
[spoiler]
Or so you thought. You end up getting betrayed by the corpse of Inquisitor Drogan and literally unleash chaos soldiers into the planet. OOPS. Now you gotta clean that up, all while your ultramarine rookie is now questioning why you’re such a gullible idiot, and in fact, betrays you at the end. Thanks, Leandros. 
[/spoiler]
Overall, the story is decent, nothing spectacular, but I enjoyed seeing the ferocity and power of what a single ultramarine is capable of. 

Length: There is multiplayer, but I focused purely on the campaign and finished it in about ~8 hours. The multiplayer seems dead, especially with SM2 out now. 

[h1][b] Gameplay (Mechanics/Difficulty) – [5/10] [/b] [/h1]
Mechanics: WH40k SM has some good mechanics. Between the shooting, the executing to restore health, and the melee combat, Titus is a murdering machine. The combat feels satisfying and generally fun, with some big caveats - 
Restoring health can get annoying if you can’t stun enemies. There are periods in the campaign with copious amounts of snipers or sentry turrets which cant be stunned, leaving you hurting as there are no health pickups, the only way to restore is with a stun + execute combo. You also take damage while in the execution animation, an animation that can literally take ~5 seconds to go through, leading to many deaths. 
Running and stopping can feel clunky as you (and your hundred pound suit) barrel on forward. 
The game isn’t designed to be a run-and-cover type shooter, so if you need to restore shields it can be difficult to be behind something fully for ~5 seconds without getting hit when your shield recharges. 
Melee can be a PITA to aim via third person. I’ve whiffed a ton of hits. 
Endless rocket orks from across the field constantly barrage you with missiles - you must pick these off before engaging in the melee, making the game feel less aggressive. 
Overall, the mechanics are pretty much like Halo or Gears of War, but with a much larger emphasis on melee combat and Master Chief weighs 2,000 pounds and can’t jump around. I had fun enough with it to finish the campaign. Unfortunately, the game starts to get really frustrating towards the end of the campaign, with the mechanics working against you - having to constantly stand behind cover while ranged enemies destroy your shield in seconds and you can’t get close to execute and restore health. It really makes the campaign feel like a slog at the end. 

Difficulty: Actually, fairly difficult. I played the campaign on the normal difficulty and died many times. I found the restore health on execute mechanic to be a big issue with issue #1 above - ranged enemies + execute animation lead to so many deaths. 

[h1] [b] Graphics (Quality/Performance) – [2/10] [/b] [/h1]
Quality: The game does not age well. Combat from afar looks good enough, but any cutscenes or close-ups just look awful. There aren't really any settings to improve the fidelity as there is pretty much resolution only and a handful of minor options. 

Performance: I experienced no performance issues in the game, but launching the game itself was an adventure. It straight up wouldn’t launch due to updating an executable that I couldn’t get past. I ended up downloading a fix from GitHub and also making the .exe run in compatibility for Windows 8 (I’m on W11) + run as administrator. A combination of those 3 things seemed to have fixed it cause it launched after that.  
i9-13900KF | RTX 4090 | 64GB RAM | 1440p @ 240hz | installed on SSD

[h1] [b] Audio (Sound Effects/Music) – [4/10] [/b] [/h1]
Sound Effects: Sound is good enough. Battles sound good, guns sound good, and chainsaws sound like chainsaws. There is voice acting here, but I found the voices super quiet, there seems to be some possible issue with sound direction - voices are quiet unless you are facing who is talking. 

Music: Didn’t really even notice any good music worth mentioning here. Maybe a song or 2 during the entire campaign, but kind of a let down when you compare it to Halo’s iconic music. 

[h1] [b] Replay Factor (Longevity) – [2/10] [/b] [/h1]
Not much of a reason to replay the campaign, and while there is multiplayer, I tried searching for a game and it was dead. Thus, I cannot say W40k SM has good replayability. 

[h1] [b] Final Verdict – [4/10] [/b] [/h1]
While I thought that there were some great moments with Titus and some fun battles, I really don’t think Space Marine 1 has aged well. I felt like I was fighting against the health restoring mechanics as much as I was the orks. By having ample ranged-only enemies, I was forced to play the game in a way that made it less fun - hiding behind cover and waiting for a shield to recharge. 
Even aside from the combat mechanics, the game world didn’t feel like a W40k universe aside from some occasional symbolism. It was pretty much a war-torn world that could have been anything. 
Lastly, I do not like the practice of this game increasing in price solely because of SM2’s release. You can literally look at Isthereanydeal.com and see the price of $8 back in 2012, now the game is currently on sale for $13 for the winter 2024 sale. I would say this game is worth a playthrough at $8, but I cannot justify or recommend doubling the price because of a sequel coming out. Bad move, SEGA. 
Instead, I recommend picking up Halo: Master Chief Collection for a better shooting campaign, or W40k Darktide for a superior game universe. 

[h1] [b] Recommend? [Y/N] [/b] [/h1]
[h1]No[/h1]
You can find my curator page here: https://steamcommunity.com/groups/Synik_GR

184248306.review:
If you are WH40K enjoyer, you will love this game, if you're not, you will still like it.

People who made this understood the assignment perfectly, cos it's so good.

Gameplay loop is nice, animations are smooth, even your characters walking feels like it has some weight behind it.

Combat is easy to get into, with both melee and guns feeling meaty and punchy both visually and soundwise. The game uses regenerating shield mechanic with a twist; you actually have to stay in combat and execute your enemies to regain health, with the shields being rechargable, which makes melee combat more viable option.

Progression is also pretty good, with you getting upgrades and better guns at an even pace with some room for experimentation.

Levels are varied even though colors are a bit lacking, making them feel a bit same-y.

Enemy variety is okey with the bulk of the enemies being different type of Orkz, with a few surprises here and there.

Plot is pretty straight forward, but for what it is, it's totally fine and the game lasts just enough to not overstay it's welcome.

I would highly recommend this adventure of Chad Titus for everyone.

184185781.review:
In terms of a third person shooter (unless you're a big 40k fan) it’s just average. The melee combat just doesn’t feel good to me since it only takes a few enemies to shred your health and the lack of invulnerability during executions means you can just be killed while trying to get your health back mid combat; combine that with enemies that have a lack of flinch when hit and it’s just not that fun to engage with, even with the strongest melee weapon. The shooting gameplay is just fine, nothing bad about it necessarily but it’s missing a major aspect of a third person shoot for me, a cover system. I can understand why the developers maybe thought it’d be out of place because you’re playing as a walking tank and it’d maybe seem odd to take cover when you look like you eat bullets for breakfast, but it’s a core part of third person shooter gameplay for me and in a way it feels like damage was balanced as if you could snap to cover. The game feels inspired by Gears of War and yet it leaves out one of the most memorable aspects of that series for me, seeing these huge roided up characters running and slamming themselves into cover.

Overall it’s not a bad game, but it’s fairly mediocre in terms of third person shooters. If you’re a 40k fan I’m not gonna say don’t play it, since there’s likely more enjoyment to be had if you’re read up on the lore for the game’s setting, but for a non-40k fan like myself I’d consider passing over this one. I wouldn’t recommend picking it up at full price either way, however, the game is pretty old and I’d say the campaign is maybe 7 hours long and I personally don’t think that’s enough to justify a $40 price tag. There is multiplayer but it’s an old game from the era of tacked on multiplayer modes so I wouldn’t expect much from that aside from maybe some hardcore fanatics still populating lobbies.

Side Note: If you think the ally AI is bad in the sequel you're in for a show here, I honestly forgot I had 2 squadmates for 90% of the game with how little they do.

184065290.review:
[h1]If a job is worth doing, it is worth dying for[/h1]

The month of December is the month where I play shooters and if I am being real here, [b]Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine[/b], has to be the best third-person shooter I have played this year, single-player-wise. I have been getting into [b]Warhammer 40,000[/b] by reading the lore and I am also playing the first [b]Dawn of War[/b] game. I got into the series thanks to [b]Space Marine 2[/b], but I haven’t played the game yet.

[h1]Pros and Cons[/h1]
[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]An action-packed story that is in line with the lore
[*]Fantastic gameplay with some fun weapons to use
[*]Surprisingly difficult but fair difficulty
[*]Lots of enemy variety
[*]Nice graphics
[/list]
[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]Sometimes you can get stuck in corners thanks to the enemies overwhelming you
[*]Online is mostly dead
[/list]
[h1]Story[/h1]
After an invasion of [b]Orks[/b] spelled with a k, the [b]Imperial Military[/b] deploys a group of [b]Space Marines[/b] of the [b]Ultramarines[/b] chapter to reclaim the planet fully. The [b]Orks[/b] have gotten some of the [b]Imperium's[/b] cannons and are using them to prevent [b]Astra Militarum[/b] from getting reinforcements.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3393938376
The story for the game is really good, it’s full of action and the characters are all just great, the story is even in line with the lore of [b]40K[/b], which is a nice touch. There was never a dull moment in the story, and it was just fantastic from start to finish, full of action and suspense.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Now [b]War Hammer Space Marine[/b] is a basic third-person shooter, however, that’s not a bad thing. The gameplay is fantastic, there was never a dull moment in its gameplay, and all the weapons that the game gives you, are just fantastic to use. I never found a weapon that I did not like using as each of them had its uses in different scenarios, something that I will give the game praise for. You can also execute enemies with your melee weapon to regain lost health, which can be useful in a pinch.

The game also gives you opportunities to use these said weapons on more than one occasion which is something I really did like. None of them were really forgotten and they are all just fun to use. My favorite melee weapon has to be The [b]Thunder Hammer[/b], it does a lot of damage but at the cost of you only being able to use your pistol and assault rifle. It is hard to pick my favorite gun though as all of them just felt nice to use. I have never played a shooter where there has been no weapon that I did not like using, which is a first.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3393938091
While attacking enemies, you will build up this meter, when full, you can activate it to do increased damage, and you will be healed while in this state for melee. However, there is also something else you can do with this rage meter. If you aim with your guns in this state, you can slow down time to get a better aim on your enemies, while also doing increased damage. This rage meter has two different uses, and it is a genuinely nice touch.

The game is also surprisingly difficult, and I love that it is this way, if you are looking for a challenging shooter, then I recommend playing on hard mode like I did.

There are tons of enemy varieties, each having its own move sets and ways to attack the player. Later in the game, the forces of [b]Chaos[/b] are introduced, adding another layer of excitement to the game. This is something I highly enjoyed as it brought something completely new to the game and this game came out in 2011. I am not saying this is the first game to do this concept, but it is something I don’t see games often do in the modern day. For shooters mostly, however, if I am wrong then anyone can provide any other examples, I would welcome it.

As much as [b]Warhammer Space Marine[/b] is fun, I do have two issues with the game, that doesn’t hold it back completely though. The first one is that sometimes you can get stuck in corners when you are dealing with a bunch of enemies. This can sometimes lead to your death but it’s not something that can completely screw you over.

Other than that, online is dead but some people are trying to get some games going so keep an eye out and see if you can find some people to play.

[h1]Graphics and Performance[/h1]
The graphics for the game are nice, it feels like you are in the [b]40K[/b] world, and I love it. I tested the game on an NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 3GB, AMD Ryzen 5 1500X Quad-Core Processor 3.50, and 16 GB of RAM, I had no issues while playing and the game ran very well.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3393938857
[h1]Final Verdict[/h1]
[b]Warhammer Space Marine[/b] is a fantastic third-person shooter that still holds up today. If you are looking for a fun shooter or are a [b]Warhammer[/b] fan. Then I highly recommend you check this game out, it’s fun from start to finish. That also can give you a challenge as well, something that I did enjoy.

183916828.review: This is a fun game. There are some performance issues when V Sync is activated, but once those were fixed, I had a good time. There are a couple sections with enemy spawns that feel unfair or can really punish players who are using specific weapon combinations without a way to fix it, but overall, I would say it is a fun campaign. The enemy variety is fairly low, but there is enough variety to not get bored. The story is straightforward with a simple, straightforward twist that introduces a new enemy faction. The graphics appear standard for the time of release, but the art direction is great. I am not a 40k fan specifically, but I really enjoyed the art style and the atmosphere of this game. The weapon variety is fun as well, I tended to focus on melee throughout the mid game, but had to focus on energy weapons for a lot of the late game. The biggest issue with this game is the lack of a level select paired with constant "you can't go back" checkpoints. There was a portion of the game that I had to cheese because I couldn't go back to change the weapons I had, and I couldn't restart the level, only the checkpoint. Otherwise, it was a fun experience!

Un juego bastante corto y promedio que cumple exactamente con su cometido actual y es el de introducir/preparar al jugador para la segunda parte.

Que decir? todos estamos aquí porque queremos jugar Space Marine II con un mínimo de contexto y la verdad en este juego no lo van a encontrar, más allá de los escasos acontecimientos que suceden en las horas en que transcurre la campaña que perfectamente se pueden cubrir en un vídeo de Youtube, el juego no se toma la molestia de explicar ni los conceptos más básicos de Warhammer 40k, como por ejemplo que es un Space Marine o la guardia imperial, que es la Inquisición, que es la disformidad, los demonios o los orcos.

El juego te da a lo que vienes que es disparos y más disparos. Posteriormente ofrece un modo multijugador que asumo que seguirá activo porque he visto que otros amigos tienen logros en ellos pero la verdad como soy un jugador de story mode no me interesa. 

De todas formas lo recomiendo porque tiene una jugabilidad aceptable y gracias al Anniversary Edition update se ve bastante bien para los años que tiene. 

En conclusión jugarlo aporta algo si al menos para conocer a Titus el protagonista pero no es imprescindible.

183590887.review:
Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine на перший погляд захоплює: атмосфера всесвіту передана добре, а бої виглядають епічно. Але є нюанси, які сильно знижують задоволення від гри.

Головний розчарування — бензопила-меч. Це зброя виглядає круто і змушує хотіти рвати ворогів у ближньому бою, але її урон занадто малий. Навіть попри ефектність, користуватися мечем стає просто невигідно. Легше стріляти — там урон проходить відчутно краще, і це позбавляє геймплей різноманітності.

Вороги поводяться агресивно, бої насичені, але місцями здаються несправедливими. До того ж, локації досить однотипні й похмурі, що швидко набридає. Гра могла б бути на рівень вище з кращим балансом і різноманітнішим геймплеєм.

Оцінка: 6/10

The story is engaging and keeps you hooked, adding depth to the high-octane action. Overall, it's a thrilling experience that stands the test of time. I can’t wait to dive into the new installment!
